snippet: A lawyer for Ms. Davis, jailed after defying a court order to issue marriage licenses, said she “needs some rest and time with the family.”
abstract: Legal representatives for Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis say she will spend time with her family before returning to work following a five-day stint in jail; attorneys do not indicate whether Davis plans to comply with court's order that she not interfere with the issuance of marriage licenses to same-sex couples upon her return to her duties.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Ms. Davis, jailed after defying a court order to issue marriage licenses, said she “needs some rest and time with the family.”

headline.main: Kim Davis Takes Break From Work, but Commotion Goes On
headline.print_headline: County Clerk to Rest; Marriages Go On

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
